source.title: Opinion: Ask your doctor if the World Series is right for you ...

facts: Drug companies bought $895.8 million worth of ads in sports programming last year.
Prescription drug ads were once banned on broadcasts, but are now permitted with clear dual-modality risk statements by the FDA.
The baseball playoffs offer a captive audience often consisting of older individuals who may have common diseases like diabetes and high cholesterol.

neutral.headline: Advertising Spending on Sports Programming
neutral.body_html: Drug companies invested $895.8 million in advertisements during sports programming last year.

conservative.headline: Prescription Drug Ads Now Permitted with FDA Guidelines
conservative.body_html: Due to the argument of free speech, prescription drug ads were once banned on broadcasts but are now allowed by the FDA as long as dual-modality risk statements about possible side effects are clearly stated.

liberal.headline: Advertising and Health Awareness During Baseball Season
liberal.body_html: The baseball playoffs, watched by millions including a captive audience of older individuals with common diseases like diabetes and high cholesterol, provide an opportunity for drug companies to advertise prescription drugs while also raising awareness about these conditions.
